metadata.title: CVE-2020-6829 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When performing EC scalar point multiplication, the wNAF pointmultiplication algorithm was used; which leaked partial information aboutthe nonce used during signature generation. Given an electro-magnetic traceof a few signature generations, the private key could have been computed.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4').
firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
